revised_title: The Origin and General Phenomena of Double Refraction in Regular Crystals
tldr: The author, David Brewster, explains the origin and general phenomena of double refraction in regular crystals. He suggests that the property of double refraction is not inherent in the molecules themselves but results from their compression due to extraneous forces or inherent attraction of aggregation. The author also discusses the effects of heat and pressure on fluids and crystals, and how these forces influence their optical properties.
